Key Match Events: Rafael Devers' intentional walk by Gerrit Cole with no one on base sparked a three-run fourth inning.
Devers added a two-run single in Boston's four-run fifth inning.
Gerrit Cole gave up seven runs, his most since June 9, 2022.
Brayan Bello gave up one run and four hits in 5 1/3 innings for the Red Sox.
Zach Penrod made his big league debut for Boston in the eighth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Red Sox manager Alex Cora commented on Cole's intentional walk, suggesting Cole did not want to face Devers.
Rafael Devers expressed surprise at being intentionally walked by Gerrit Cole.
Gerrit Cole reflected on the intentional walk, admitting it was the wrong move.
Yankees manager Aaron Boone expressed a preference for attacking the Red Sox after scoring the first run.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A sellout crowd of 46,378 pushed the Yankees over 3 million in home attendance for the third straight season and 24th in a row other than 2020-21.
Boston selected Zach Penrod's contract from Worcester and recalled left-hander Bailey Horn from the Triple-A farm team.
Red Sox RHP Tanner Houck is tentatively slated to start Wednesday at Tampa Bay.
